facts.text: Bhander Assembly Constituency is a seat reserved for scheduled caste candidate.
Last date for filing nomination papers was January 20, 1967; date of scrutiny was January 21, 1967; poll took place on February 20, 1967; result declared on February 21, 1967.
Returned candidate (Kishorilal, appellant in C.A. No. 2123/69) obtained 24,549 votes; respondent No. 1 (Rajaram Singh) obtained 8,096 votes.
Election petition filed by Rajaram Singh under s. 81 of Representation of People Act, 1951 challenging election of Kishorilal.
Name of returned candidate entered in electoral roll for Seondha Assembly Constituency No. 2, district Datia, part No. 81, village Bargawan, serial No. 154; permanent resident of that village.
Returned candidate belonged to Jatav caste, which is not a scheduled caste for Datia district.

Under Constitution (Scheduled Castes) Order 1950 and Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Lists (Modification) Order 1956, for district Datia: Item 3 - Chamar, Ahirwar, Chamar Mangan, Mochi or Raidas; Jatav not recognised as scheduled caste.
Returned candidate admitted residence in Bargawan but denied belonging to Jatav caste; claimed to belong to Chamar caste and that Jatav is a sub-caste of Chamar.

Pamphlets Exhs. P-16, P-17, P-18 issued by Jatav organizations showing returned candidate as convener or Mantri/Secretary of Jatav Sabha Datia; related to Jatav Sammelans demanding recognition of Jatav as separate caste.
Deputation by Provincial Jatav Sabha to Collector Datia on January 12, 1961, complaining officers not recording Jatav caste; Collector ordered to record Jatav.
Resolution Exh. P-60 at Jatav Sammelan Tharet on October 24, 1963, demanding scholarships for Jatav community; seconded by returned candidate.
In criminal proceedings 1964, personal bond Exh. P-10 dated May 6, 1964, returned candidate gave caste as Jatav; similar in Exhs. P-55, P-56.

High Court found returned candidate belonged to Jatav caste (sub-issue a affirmative); did not possess qualifications for SC seat (sub-issue b); no inquiry into whether Jatav sub-caste of Chamar (sub-issue c); Jatav recorded as SC for Bhander (d affirmative), but not entitled due to residence in Datia (e negative).
Returned candidate attended Jatav Sammelans in Bhander tehsil, including Mouza Barchouli.
Revenue records showed ancestors of returned candidate as Chamar, but High Court held rebutted by other evidence.
Memorial Exh. P-57 dated July 17, 1956 by President Jatav Sabha protesting non-recognition of Jatav as separate SC.
In Constitution (Scheduled Castes) Order 1950, Jatav not shown in Madhya Pradesh, Madhya Bharat, Vindhya Pradesh; only Chamar etc.
Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Orders Amendment Act 1956: Jatav included in Madhya Bharat but not Madhya Pradesh or Vindhya Pradesh.
After States Reorganisation, Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Lists (Modification) Order 1956: Jatav included in some districts (e.g., Bhind) but not Datia (former Vindhya Pradesh).

legal_issues.text: Whether respondent No. 1 Shri Kishorilal belongs to the Jatav caste; whether therefore he does not belong to scheduled caste and does not possess necessary qualifications for reserved SC seat in Bhander Assembly Constituency; whether Jatav is sub-caste of Chamar; whether Jatav recorded as SC for Bhander; whether entitled despite being voter in Seondha (Datia).
Whether returned candidate was a member of scheduled caste and qualified to stand for reserved seat.

petitioner_arguments.text: Returned candidate belongs to Jatav caste, not scheduled caste in Datia district; fraudulently concealed Jatav and represented as Chamar.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Constitution (Scheduled Castes) Order 1950; Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Lists (Modification) Order 1956

respondent_arguments.text: Belongs to Chamar caste; Jatav is sub-caste of Chamar; even if separate, Jatav recorded as SC for Bhander constituency.
Certain section of Chamars in district call themselves Jatav as they gave up shoemaking; all Jatavs in Datia are Chamars; mention of Chamar includes them.

court_reasoning.text: High Court rightly relied on pamphlets (P-16,17,18), resolutions (P-60), bonds (P-10,55,56) showing returned candidate as Jatav and office-bearer in Jatav organizations demanding separate recognition.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Documents from 1960-1964 consistently show returned candidate as Jatav, not Chamar.

court_reasoning.text: Returned candidate's own evidence confused: claimed Chamar but admitted Jatav sub-caste and organized Jatav Sammelans.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No proper foundation laid for case that Chamars wanted to be called Jatavs.

court_reasoning.text: Revenue entries as Chamar have presumptive value only, rebutted by representations for Jatav recognition; Collector directed recording as Jatav.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Jatav exists as separate caste in Datia despite not officially recorded as SC.

court_reasoning.text: Jatav recognized as separate caste in statutory orders for Madhya Bharat etc.; cannot be same as Chamar per precedents; no inquiry permissible into sub-caste equivalence under Art. 341.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Following Bhaiyalal and Basavalingappa, cannot establish Jatav same as Chamar.

holdings.text: Returned candidate belongs to Jatav caste, separate and distinct from Chamar; Jatav not included as scheduled caste in Datia district per Presidential Order; disqualified to contest reserved SC seat.
No permissible inquiry whether Jatav is sub-caste or same as Chamar under Art. 341; must strictly follow scheduled castes specified in Orders.

precedents_cited.relevance: President authorised under Art. 341 to specify parts/groups of castes; no inquiry into sub-caste equivalence; Dohar not Chamar.
Generally not open to lead evidence that one caste is same as or includes another specified in Order.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Filing election petition; appeals; qualifications for candidature.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Specification of scheduled castes by President; limits on inquiry into caste status.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution (Scheduled Castes) Order 1950
statutes_cited.relevance: Lists scheduled castes; Chamar included, Jatav not in relevant areas.

statutes_cited.name: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Orders Amendment Act, 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Amended lists; Jatav included in some states/areas, not others.

statutes_cited.name: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes Lists (Modification) Order 1956
statutes_cited.relevance: Post-reorganisation; Jatav not included in Datia district.

outcome.summary: Appeal by returned candidate (C.A. 2123/69) dismissed, upholding High Court finding of disqualification; cross-appeal (C.A. 2237/69) not pressed and dismissed.
outcome.relief_granted: Election of Kishorilal set aside by High Court upheld.

key_quotes.text: "It is difficult to disagree with the High Court that he had failed to prove that he was a Chamar and not a Jatav."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "Following these two decisions it must be held that the returned candidate, in the present case, was not entitled to establish that Jatav caste was the same as Chamar."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Application of precedents barring sub-caste inquiry.

key_quotes.text: "I am a Chamar. I am not a Jatav. As a Jatav Chamar I did not organise any Sammelan..."
key_quotes.speaker: returned_candidate
key_quotes.significance: Illustrates confusion in returned candidate's testimony.
